text: Family Member: You can handle that. Doctor: Yeah, there is like a you know, plus minus, so if it’s like a special thing you know, might be five or six weeks so we can work with you guys. Doctor: Yeah, for standard dosing, just no trial, just once for an hour every three weeks is the infusion. Doctor: Not if it’s a trial. If it’s a trial. Family Member: If it’s not a trial he could get it at K____ C_____? Doctor: Yeah. text: Patient: Okay. Doctor: That might take a minute. Patient: Okay. Family Member: In addition to the radium or that? Doctor: No, that is the radium. Patient: Oh, that is the radium. Doctor: Yeah. So, there’s different names. Family Member: Oh, I got you. Doctor: Radium, there’s liquid radiation, there’s Xofigo, which is the trade name, and, you know, we don’t give it but the radiation oncology doctors give it because it is a form of radiation. text: Healthcare Professional: It’s really so I don’t forget it later. Doctor: Okay, we’re having a good discussion. They were afraid I was gonna give them a quiz at the end of it but I think we’re good. Healthcare Professional: Alright, I promise not to, no, I probably shouldn’t promise I won’t interrupt again. Doctor: Of course you won’t. Family Member: So, if it’s bone only after the scans, Doctor: Yeah Family Member: it’s radium for sure? Doctor: Well, it’s radium as an option. You know, you guys might look at that and go um, I don’t know how I feel about it and after you talk to the radiation doctor who administers it, you know, some people might say oh, gosh, I just worried about it and I’d rather take chemo and that’s okay too. I’m just trying to make it so easy. I mean any and all of this is interchangeable. If you had just bone only, you could get chemo Patient: Okay. Doctor: but if you have not just bone you can’t get radium. So, radium is only good for one thing. You got bone you can get radium. Patient: Radium. Doctor: It can’t go anywhere else. So, if it’s anywhere else other than bone, no go on the radium. Taxotere, you know, chemo could be anywhere anytime, less picky. Patient: What happened to the radiation that I took for the forty some days? Whatever did that do any good or it did nothing or what?

Doctor-Patient-Conversation-Analysis-pos.text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Our goal is to understand how doctors can communicate better with patients by looking at different perceptions of the doctors’ qualities. Understanding your personal experiences with the medical system will help us to contextualize your responses. We invite you to share insights by answering the following questions. Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.
Doctor-Patient-Conversation-Analysis-pos.displayed_text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Our goal is to understand how doctors can communicate better with patients by looking at different perceptions of the doctors’ qualities. Understanding your personal experiences with the medical system will help us to contextualize your responses. We invite you to share insights by answering the following questions. Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.
